title: Heartbreak House
author: George Bernard Shaw
description: Men and women of the English leisured classes gather at a country house on the eve of war to discuss love, life, and the future.
longDescription: Published in 1919, Heartbreak House is an examination of the failings of the European leisure classes before World War I - failings that author George Bernard Shaw blamed for the war, and that he predicted would quickly lead to another, longer war.

The play is set in an English country house, where representatives of every type of English society have gathered at the home of the seemingly-mad Captain Shotover. Hidebound aristocrats and cultured bohemians, wealthy capitalists and radical idealists, prim moralists and idle libertines, are all laid bare in one of Shaw's bleakest and yet most absurd plays.
